newsitem.title: USA: Revlon, Cosmetic Center to merge.
newsitem.headline: Revlon, Cosmetic Center to merge.

text.p: The Cosmetic Center Inc said on Wednesday it signed a definitive agreement to merge with Revlon Inc's retail outlet subsidiary, Prestige Fragrance & Cosmetics Inc.
The company said the new entity would keep the Cosmetic Center name. The deal is expected to close in early 1997.
Terms of the transaction are consistent with those announced on Oct. 1 when the companies executed a non-binding letter of intent.
Cosmetic Center's class A and class B shareholders can exchange their shares to get either one share of Cosmetic Center's newly issued class C voting common stock or $7.63 in cash.

Holders of the company's employee stock options can choose equivalent options for class C voting common stock or, if their exercise prices are less than $7.63, cash in an amount equal to $7.63 less the exercise price for each option share, the company said.
According to the agreement, Revlon will limit to 2,829,065 the number of shares and options would be accepted for cash and prorate the rest.
Revlon will receive about 65 percent of the newly issued class C voting shares outstanding on a fully diluted basis before taking into account shares and options exchanged for cash.

As of Sept. 30, there were about 4,296,134 shares of Cosmetic Center's Class A and Class B common stock outstanding and about 201,900 options with exercise prices of less than $7.63, the company said.

Mark Weinstein, the Cosmetic Center chairman, and certain family members, who together own about 51 percent of Cosmetic Center's Class B voting shares, agreed to elect to receive cash for all of their shares and options, subject to proration. As a result, Revlon would own at least 74 percent and up to 84 percent of Cosmetic Center's outstanding common shares, the company said.

Cosmetic Center operates 69 specialty retail stores with brand-name prestige and mass merchandised cosmetics, fragrance and beauty products at value prices. Prestige Fragrance & Cosmetics has a chain of 198 retail stores located in outlet malls that sell surplus and discontinued cosmetics and beauty merchandise.
